thread.title: Jump Back In Time To 2003 - When Ashish Nehra's Masterclass Spell Helped India Sink England - Indiatimes.com
thread.title_full: Jump Back In Time To 2003 - When Ashish Nehra's Masterclass Spell Helped India Sink England - Indiatimes.com

title: Jump Back In Time To 2003 - When Ashish Nehra's Masterclass Spell Helped India Sink England - Indiatimes.com
text:
Somak Adhikari February 06, 2017 
Ashish Nehra has been around for over 18 years now. While injury problems prevented him from becoming a long-term member of the Indian team, he did have his moments of fame. 
AFP 
One such moment came in the 2003 World Cup against England. Both teams were gunning for a Super Six spot and the winner would earn a place while the loser would be on the verge of elimination. 
Set 251 to win, England were comfortably placed at 52/2 when Nehra worked his magic. 
Nasser Hussain and Alec Stewart were dismissed off consecutive balls and all of the sudden the middle order was exposed. 
AFP 
Pace, swing and length did the batsmen in as one by one they succumbed to the left-armer. 
From 52/2, England were left reeling at 107/8. All six went to Nehra and he finished with figures of 6/23, the best bowling figures by an Indian in World Cup cricket. 
India went on to win the game by 82 runs and Nehra was the toast of the team. 
Such instances were sadly not on a consistent basis for the southpaw, but when they did come, Team India reaped the benefits. Don't Miss
